senses.sense_definition: To fasten or secure a hatch, door, or opening tightly, typically using strips of wood or metal, especially in preparation for a storm.

examples.text: The captain ordered the crew to <w>batten</w> down the hatches as the hurricane approached.
We need to <w>batten</w> the windows securely to prevent damage from the high winds.

senses.sense_definition: To prosper or thrive, especially at the expense of others or by feeding greedily on something.

examples.text: Corrupt officials often <w>batten</w> on the misery of the poor to increase their own wealth.
The tabloids seem to <w>batten</w> on the scandals and misfortunes of celebrities.

senses.sense_definition: To furnish or strengthen a structure with battens (strips of wood).

examples.text: The carpenter decided to <w>batten</w> the wall to provide extra support for the cladding.
They <w>battened</w> the roof before laying the tiles.

senses.sense_definition: A long, flat strip of wood or metal used in construction to hold materials together, provide a fixing point, or prevent warping.

examples.text: The builder nailed a wooden <w>batten</w> across the planks to keep them aligned.
You should attach the roofing felt to the <w>batten</w> before adding the tiles.

senses.sense_definition: A narrow strip of wood, plastic, or metal used on a ship, especially one inserted into a sail to keep it flat or used to secure a hatch.

examples.text: He replaced a broken <w>batten</w> in the mainsail to improve the boat's performance.
The sailors used a heavy <w>batten</w> to hold down the edge of the tarpaulin.

senses.sense_definition: A long bar or strip, usually metal, used in a theater to support lights, curtains, or scenery above the stage.

examples.text: The lighting technician lowered the <w>batten</w> to adjust the angle of the spotlights.
Heavy velvet curtains were suspended from a sturdy <w>batten</w> in the fly system.

senses.sense_definition: The movable bar of a loom that pushes the weft thread tightly against the previously woven cloth.

examples.text: The weaver pulled the <w>batten</w> forward to tighten the fabric.
A rhythmic clacking sound filled the room as the <w>batten</w> struck the threads.

senses.sense_definition: Fertile, fruitful, or nutritious; typically describing land, soil, or pasture.

examples.text: The cattle grazed contentedly on the <w>batten</w> grass of the valley.
Farmers in the region prized the <w>batten</w> soil for its ability to yield rich crops.
Mr. <w>Batten</w> has lived in this village for over fifty years.
We are looking for a file belonging to a Ms. <w>Batten</w>.
